ground_truth: The old woman stares at her suspiciously for a moment, then turns from the door and walks away. Her hand reaches out and touches it. Tommy turns and runs upstairs crying. Laurie moves from the door to the telephone. She picks it up, dials a number, and waits. She puts down the phone and stands very still. Slowly, Laurie moves around the couch. Slowly, Laurie sinks down to her knees by the couch. Her hand brushes against the knitting needles protruding from her tote bag. She reacts to the feel of the knitting needles and pulls one out. She begins crying softly, her eyes wide with fear. Suddenly, the shape leaps up from behind the couch! He springs at her, plunging the butcher knife. The blade of the butcher knife thumps into the couch. Laurie suddenly jumps backward, raising her arm instinctively. Instinctively, Laurie raises the knitting needle and drives it home, right into the shape's neck! The shape springs backward, clawing at the needle, rolling his head back and forth. Then suddenly he freezes, hands outstretched, motionless, and falls into a heap on the floor. Laurie sits there. The shape doesn't move. She stares at it. The camera moves with Loomis as he moves along the street. Suddenly two headlights hit him, and a police car swerves to a stop next to him. Standing there is the shape, the butcher knife raised. Both children scream. Laurie shoves them into the bathroom and pulls the door shut, leaving herself outside in the bedroom. There is a click as the bathroom door is locked. Laurie leaps away from the door and circles around the bed. The shape keeps coming. The shape moves for her, slowly now, but relentless, the knife glistening. Laurie dashes to a clothes closet and ducks inside. Laurie pulls the sliding doors closed and crawls back into the small, dark interior of the closet. Suddenly the doors begin to buckle as the shape pounds on them. The door buckles inward as the shape smashes against it. She reaches up and grabs a wire hanger from the top of the closet. She twists the top of the hanger, unwinding the wire. The door breaks in. The shape steps inside, pushing aside the clothes. She unhooks the hanger and bends it out straight. The shape leans in, peering down at Laurie in the corner, raising the knife. Holding the hanger with both hands, she thrusts it forward with all her might. The wire hanger flashes into the shape's right eye. He leaps back in pain, dropping the butcher knife, grabbing his eye with both hands. She grasps the butcher knife with both hands and jabs it upward. The butcher knife plunges into the shape's mid-section, right down to the hilt.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: The elderly lady gazes at her distrustfully for a second, then rotates from the doorway and strides away. Her hand extends out and brushes it. Tommy rotates and sprints upstairs weeping. Laurie shifts from the doorway to the phone. She lifts it up, dials a numeral, and pauses. She places down the receiver and stands very stationary. Gradually, Laurie shifts around the sofa. Gradually, Laurie descends down to her knees by the sofa. Her hand grazes against the knitting needles jutting from her carryall. She responds to the sensation of the knitting needles and tugs one out. She starts sobbing gently, her eyes broad with terror. Abruptly, the figure vaults up from behind the sofa! He lunges at her, thrusting the cleaver. The edge of the cleaver bumps into the sofa. Laurie abruptly leaps backward, elevating her arm reflexively. Reflexively, Laurie elevates the knitting needle and drives it in, straight into the figure's throat! The figure springs backward, clawing at the needle, rolling his head back and forth. Then abruptly he freezes, hands outstretched, motionless, and collapses into a heap on the floor. Laurie sits there. The figure doesn't move. She gazes at it. The camera shifts with Loomis as he moves along the road. Abruptly two headlights strike him, and a patrol car veers to a stop adjacent to him. Standing there is the figure, the cleaver elevated. Both youngsters yell. Laurie shoves them into the washroom and pulls the door closed, leaving herself outside in the chamber. There is a click as the washroom door is locked. Laurie bounds away from the door and circles around the bed. The figure keeps advancing. The figure moves toward her, slowly now, but unyielding, the blade gleaming. Laurie rushes to a wardrobe and crouches inside. Laurie pulls the sliding doors shut and crawls back into the small, dark space of the wardrobe. Abruptly the doors begin to distort as the figure pounds on them. The door distorts inward as the figure crashes against it. She reaches up and grabs a wire hanger from the top of the wardrobe. She twists the top of the hanger, unwinding the wire. The door shatters in. The figure steps inside, pushing aside the garments. She unhooks the hanger and bends it out straight. The figure leans in, peering down at Laurie in the corner, raising the blade. Holding the hanger with both hands, she thrusts it forward with all her strength. The wire hanger flashes into the figure's right eye. He leaps back in agony, dropping the cleaver, grabbing his eye with both hands. She grasps the cleaver with both hands and jabs it upward. The cleaver plunges into the figure's abdomen, right down to the hilt.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: The old woman is stared at suspiciously for a moment by her, then she is turned from by the old woman and walked away from. It is reached out to and touched by her hand. Upstairs, Tommy is turned and run to by him while crying. The telephone is moved to by Laurie from the door. It is picked up by her, a number is dialed, and then it is waited on by her. The phone is put down by her, and very still she stands. Slowly, around the couch it is moved by Laurie. Slowly, down to her knees by the couch, Laurie is sunk. Against the knitting needles protruding from her tote bag, her hand brushes. The feel of the knitting needles is reacted to by her, and one is pulled out by her. Softly crying is begun by her, her eyes widened with fear. Suddenly, up from behind the couch the shape is leaped! At her, he is sprung by him, and the butcher knife is plunged. Into the couch, the blade of the butcher knife is thumped. Laurie is suddenly jumped back by herself, and instinctively she raises her arm. Instinctively, the knitting needle is raised by Laurie, right into the shape's neck, and it is driven home! The needle is clawed at by the shape, who rolls his head back and forth. Then suddenly, he is frozen by him, hands outstretched, and motionless he falls into a heap on the floor. Laurie is there sitting. By the shape, movement is not made. It is stared at by her. With Loomis, the camera moves as along the street, he moves. Suddenly, Loomis is hit by two headlights, and to a stop next to him, a police car is swerved. There, standing, is the shape with the butcher knife raised. By both children, a scream is made. Into the bathroom, they are shoved by Laurie, and the door is shut by her, leaving outside herself in the bedroom. As the bathroom door is locked, a click is heard. Away from the door, Laurie leaps, and around the bed, she is circled. The shape is kept coming. For her, the shape is moved by him, now slowly, yet relentless, the knife glistening. To a clothes closet, Laurie dashes, and inside, she is ducked. The sliding doors are pulled closed by Laurie, and into the small, dark interior of the closet, she is crawled back. Suddenly, as the shape pounds on them, the doors are buckled. Inward, the door is buckled as against it, the shape smashes. Upward, she reaches and grabs from the top of the closet a wire hanger. The top of the hanger is twisted by her, and the wire is unwound. The door is broken in. Inside, the shape steps, and the clothes are pushed aside. The hanger is unhooked by her, and it is bent out straight. Down at Laurie in the corner, the shape leans in, and the knife is raised. Holding the hanger with both hands, it is thrust forward by her with all her might. Into the shape's right eye, the wire hanger is flashed. Back in pain, he leaps, and the butcher knife is dropped, and with both hands, his eye is grabbed. With both hands, the butcher knife is grasped by her, and upward it is jabbed. Into the shape's mid-section, the butcher knife is plunged by her, right down to the hilt.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: The old woman stares suspiciously, then turns and walks away. Her hand touches the door. Tommy runs upstairs crying. Laurie moves to the phone, dials, waits, then puts it down and stands still. She kneels by the couch, brushes against knitting needles, and pulls one out, crying softly in fear. Suddenly, the shape leaps from behind the couch, plunging a butcher knife, which thumps into the couch. Laurie jumps back, instinctively driving the knitting needle into the shape's neck. The shape claws at the needle, freezes, and falls motionless. Laurie sits, staring. The camera follows Loomis along the street. A police car swerves to a stop. The shape stands with a raised knife. Both children scream. Laurie shoves them into the bathroom, locks the door, and circles the bed. The shape approaches, relentless, knife glistening. Laurie dashes into a closet, pulls the doors closed, and crawls back. The shape pounds on the doors, which buckle inward. She grabs a wire hanger, unwinds it, and as the shape enters, thrusts it into his eye. He leaps back, dropping the knife. She grabs the butcher knife and jabs it into the shape's midsection.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: The old woman stares suspiciously, then walks away. Her hand touches the door. Tommy runs upstairs crying. Laurie moves to the phone, dials, waits, then puts it down. She kneels by the couch, brushes against knitting needles, pulls one out, and begins crying. Suddenly, a shape leaps from behind the couch, plunging a butcher knife into it. Laurie jumps back, instinctively driving the knitting needle into the shape's neck. The shape freezes and falls. Laurie stares at it. Loomis walks along the street when a police car stops. The shape stands with a raised knife. Both children scream. Laurie shoves them into the bathroom, locks the door, and circles the bed. The shape approaches, knife glistening. Laurie hides in a closet, pulling the doors closed. The shape pounds on them. She grabs a wire hanger, unwinds it, and thrusts it into the shape's eye. He drops the knife, and she jabs it into his midsection.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: The elderly woman fixes her gaze on her with a look of suspicion for a brief moment, then she turns away from the door and begins to walk away. Her hand extends outward and makes contact with it. Tommy, overwhelmed with emotion, turns abruptly and runs upstairs, tears streaming down his face. Laurie moves away from the door and heads toward the telephone. She picks up the receiver, carefully dials a number, and waits in silence. After a moment, she gently places the phone back down and stands very still, almost frozen in place. Slowly and deliberately, Laurie moves around the couch, her movements measured and cautious. Gradually, Laurie lowers herself down to her knees beside the couch. Her hand brushes against the knitting needles that are protruding from her tote bag. She reacts to the sensation of the knitting needles and instinctively pulls one out. She begins to cry softly, her eyes wide and filled with fear. Suddenly, a shape leaps up from behind the couch with startling speed! He springs toward her, aiming to plunge the butcher knife. The blade of the butcher knife thumps heavily into the couch. Laurie suddenly jumps backward, raising her arm instinctively in defense. Instinctively, Laurie raises the knitting needle and drives it home with force, right into the shape's neck! The shape springs backward, clawing desperately at the needle, rolling his head back and forth in agony. Then, quite suddenly, he freezes, his hands outstretched, motionless, and collapses into a heap on the floor. Laurie sits there, stunned. The shape remains motionless. She stares at it, her eyes wide. The camera follows Loomis as he moves purposefully along the street. Suddenly, two headlights illuminate him, and a police car swerves to a stop right next to him. Standing there is the shape, the butcher knife raised menacingly. Both children scream in terror. Laurie quickly shoves them into the bathroom and pulls the door shut, leaving herself outside in the bedroom. There is a distinct click as the bathroom door is locked securely. Laurie leaps away from the door and circles around the bed, her heart pounding. The shape keeps coming, moving toward her, slowly now, but with relentless determination, the knife glistening ominously. Laurie dashes to a clothes closet and ducks inside, seeking refuge. Laurie pulls the sliding doors closed and crawls back into the small, dark interior of the closet, her breath quickening. Suddenly, the doors begin to buckle as the shape pounds on them with force. The door buckles inward as the shape smashes against it with relentless power. She reaches up and grabs a wire hanger from the top of the closet, her hands trembling. She twists the top of the hanger, unwinding the wire with determination. The door breaks in with a crash. The shape steps inside, pushing aside the clothes with ease. She unhooks the hanger and bends it out straight, her mind racing. The shape leans in, peering down at Laurie in the corner, raising the knife with intent. Holding the hanger with both hands, she thrusts it forward with all her might, her heart pounding. The wire hanger flashes into the shape's right eye, causing him to leap back in pain, dropping the butcher knife, and grabbing his eye with both hands. She grasps the butcher knife with both hands and jabs it upward with all her strength. The butcher knife plunges into the shape's mid-section, right down to the hilt, with a sickening thud.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: The elderly woman directs her gaze toward her, fixing her eyes with a hint of suspicion for just a brief moment before turning away from the door and starting to walk in the opposite direction. Her hand reaches outwards, extending until it makes contact with it. Overcome with a torrent of emotion, Tommy turns abruptly on his heels and races upstairs, tears freely streaming down his cheeks. Laurie gently moves away from the door, making her way toward the telephone situated nearby. She lifts up the receiver with care, slowly and meticulously dials a number, then waits in utter silence. After a short moment, she gently places the phone back onto the cradle and stands completely still, as if frozen in place by an unseen force. With slow and deliberate movements, Laurie navigates her way around the couch, each step measured and cautious. Gradually, and with a sense of purpose, Laurie lowers herself down to her knees beside the couch. Her hand lightly brushes against the knitting needles that protrude from her tote bag. Reacting to the sensation of the knitting needles, she instinctively pulls one out. She begins to cry softly, her eyes wide open and brimming with fear. Suddenly, with startling speed, a shape leaps up from behind the couch! He lunges toward her, aiming to plunge the butcher knife into her. The blade of the butcher knife thumps heavily into the couch with a dull sound. Laurie jumps backward in sudden shock, raising her arm instinctively in defense. With instinct taking over, Laurie thrusts the knitting needle forward with force, driving it into the shape's neck! The shape recoils, clawing desperately at the needle lodged in his neck, his head rolling back and forth in sheer agony. Then, quite suddenly, he freezes, his hands outstretched in a motionless pose, and collapses into a motionless heap on the floor. Laurie sits there, utterly stunned. The shape remains completely still. She stares at it, eyes wide with disbelief. The camera follows Loomis as he makes his way purposefully along the street. Suddenly, two glaring headlights illuminate him as a police car swerves to a sudden stop right next to him. Standing there is the shape, brandishing the butcher knife raised in a menacing manner. Both children scream in utter terror. Laurie quickly ushers them into the bathroom, securing them safely inside, and shuts the door firmly behind them, leaving herself outside in the bedroom. A distinct click echoes as the bathroom door is locked securely from the outside. Laurie leaps away from the door, scampering around the bed, her heart pounding intensely. The shape continues his advance, moving toward her, slowly now, but with relentless determination, the knife glistening ominously in his hand. Laurie dashes toward a clothing closet and quickly ducks inside, seeking refuge and safety. Inside, Laurie pulls the sliding doors closed behind her, crawling back into the small, dark interior of the closet, her breath coming in quick gasps. Suddenly, with unstoppable force, the doors begin to buckle as the shape pounds on them with tremendous power. The door buckles inward under the relentless smashing of the shape's assault. She reaches up with trembling hands and grabs a wire hanger from the top of the closet. Determinedly, she twists the top of the hanger, unwinding the wire with a focused resolve. The door crashes in with a resounding bang. The shape steps inside, effortlessly pushing aside the hanging clothes. She unhooks the hanger and bends it out straight, her mind racing with urgency. The shape leans in closer, peering down at Laurie in the corner of the closet, raising the knife with clear intent to strike. Holding the hanger with both hands, she thrusts it forward with all her might, her heart racing. The wire hanger flashes into the shape's right eye, causing him to leap back in immediate pain, dropping the butcher knife and grabbing his injured eye with both hands. She quickly grasps the butcher knife with both hands, jabbing it upward with all her strength. The butcher knife plunges into the shape's midsection, driving straight down to the hilt with a sickening thud.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: The old woman fixes her gaze on her with a suspicious look, holding it for a moment before deciding to turn away from the door and walk away, leaving the scene. Her hand tentatively reaches out, making contact with the door. Meanwhile, Tommy, overwhelmed with emotion, turns abruptly and dashes upstairs, tears streaming down his face. Laurie, feeling the weight of the moment, moves deliberately from the door to the telephone, picking it up with a sense of urgency. She carefully dials a number and waits, listening intently for a response. After a moment, she gently places the phone back down and stands very still, absorbing the silence. Slowly, Laurie begins to move around the couch, her movements deliberate and cautious. She gradually sinks down to her knees beside the couch, her hand inadvertently brushing against the knitting needles that protrude from her tote bag. The unexpected sensation of the knitting needles prompts a reaction, and she instinctively pulls one out. As she does so, she begins to cry softly, her eyes widening with fear as the reality of the situation sets in. Suddenly, a shape leaps up from behind the couch, springing towards her with alarming speed, wielding a butcher knife. The blade of the knife thumps into the couch as Laurie, driven by instinct, jumps backward, raising her arm defensively. In a swift, instinctive motion, Laurie raises the knitting needle and drives it with precision into the shape's neck. The shape recoils, clawing at the needle embedded in his neck, his head rolling back and forth in agony. Then, in an instant, he freezes, his hands outstretched and motionless, before collapsing into a heap on the floor. Laurie remains seated, her eyes fixed on the unmoving shape, her mind processing the gravity of what just occurred. Meanwhile, the camera follows Loomis as he moves purposefully along the street. Suddenly, two headlights illuminate him as a police car swerves to a stop beside him. Standing there is the shape, the butcher knife raised menacingly. Both children scream in terror as Laurie urgently shoves them into the bathroom, pulling the door shut behind them, leaving herself outside in the bedroom. There is a distinct click as the bathroom door is locked, securing the children inside. Laurie leaps away from the door, her heart racing, and begins to circle around the bed, aware that the shape is still coming for her. The shape moves towards her with a slow but relentless determination, the knife glistening ominously. In a desperate bid to escape, Laurie dashes to a clothes closet and ducks inside, pulling the sliding doors closed behind her and retreating into the small, dark interior. Suddenly, the doors begin to buckle under the force of the shape pounding on them, each impact more forceful than the last. As the door buckles inward, the shape smashes against it with increasing intensity. In a moment of quick thinking, she reaches up and grabs a wire hanger from the top of the closet, twisting the top to unwind the wire. Just as the door breaks in and the shape steps inside, pushing aside the clothes, she unhooks the hanger and bends it out straight. The shape leans in, peering down at Laurie in the corner, raising the knife with intent. Holding the hanger with both hands, she thrusts it forward with all her might, the wire hanger flashing into the shape's right eye. He leaps back in pain, dropping the butcher knife and grabbing his eye with both hands. Seizing the opportunity, she grasps the butcher knife with both hands and jabs it upward, the blade plunging into the shape's mid-section, right down to the hilt, delivering a decisive blow.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: The old woman briefly scrutinizes her before turning away from the door. Laurie touches the door, prompting Tommy to run upstairs crying. Laurie moves to the telephone, dials a number, waits, and then sets the phone down, standing still. She slowly approaches the couch, kneels beside it, and brushes against the knitting needles in her tote bag. Reacting to their touch, she pulls one out and begins crying softly, eyes wide with fear. Suddenly, the shape leaps from behind the couch, attacking with a butcher knife that thuds into the couch as Laurie jumps back, instinctively raising the knitting needle and driving it into the shape's neck. The shape recoils, clawing at the needle, then freezes and collapses motionless on the floor. Laurie sits, staring at the unmoving shape. Meanwhile, Loomis walks along the street when a police car swerves to a stop beside him. The shape, with a raised butcher knife, stands there, causing both children to scream. Laurie shoves them into the bathroom, locks the door, and circles the bed as the shape advances slowly but relentlessly. She dashes into a closet, pulls the sliding doors closed, and retreats into the dark interior. As the shape pounds on the doors, she grabs a wire hanger, unwinds it, and straightens it. When the door breaks in and the shape enters, she thrusts the hanger into his right eye. The shape recoils in pain, dropping the knife. Laurie seizes the butcher knife and plunges it into the shape's midsection.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: The old woman, once known in the neighborhood for her unwelcoming demeanor, stares at her suspiciously for a moment, then turns from the door and walks away. Her hand, trembling slightly with age, reaches out and touches it. Tommy, who had been frightened by tales of the neighborhood haunted house, turns and runs upstairs crying. Laurie moves from the door to the telephone, a rotary model that connects through an antiquated landline system. She picks it up, dials a number, and waits, listening to the distant ringing echo through the receiver. She puts down the phone and stands very still, her mind racing with uncertainty. Slowly, Laurie moves around the couch, a piece of furniture that has been in the family for generations, showing signs of wear and tear. Slowly, Laurie sinks down to her knees by the couch, her mind consumed with dread. Her hand brushes against the knitting needles protruding from her tote bag, a gift from her grandmother who taught her to knit. She reacts to the feel of the knitting needles and pulls one out, clutching it like a lifeline. She begins crying softly, her eyes wide with fear, aware of the growing danger. Suddenly, the shape, a mysterious figure cloaked in shadow, leaps up from behind the couch! He springs at her, plunging the butcher knife, a weapon with a blade honed to deadly sharpness. The blade of the butcher knife thumps into the couch. Laurie suddenly jumps backward, raising her arm instinctively in defense. Instinctively, Laurie raises the knitting needle and drives it home, right into the shape's neck, her instincts overriding her fear. The shape springs backward, clawing at the needle, rolling his head back and forth in agony. Then suddenly he freezes, hands outstretched, motionless, and falls into a heap on the floor. Laurie sits there, her breath quick and shallow. The shape doesn't move, lying still as death. She stares at it, her mind struggling to process what just happened. The camera moves with Loomis, the town's dedicated doctor who knows more than anyone about the shape's past, as he moves along the street. Suddenly two headlights hit him, and a police car, responding to the town's growing alarm, swerves to a stop next to him. Standing there is the shape, the butcher knife raised defiantly. Both children scream, their fear echoing through the house. Laurie shoves them into the bathroom and pulls the door shut, leaving herself outside in the bedroom. There is a click as the bathroom door is locked, a temporary shield against the danger. Laurie leaps away from the door and circles around the bed, her mind racing for a plan. The shape keeps coming, unstoppable, his movements slow but purposeful, the knife glistening ominously. Laurie dashes to a clothes closet and ducks inside, seeking the safety of cramped quarters. Laurie pulls the sliding doors closed and crawls back into the small, dark interior of the closet, her heart pounding in her ears. Suddenly the doors begin to buckle as the shape pounds on them, trying to break through her last refuge. The door buckles inward as the shape smashes against it with relentless force. She reaches up and grabs a wire hanger from the top of the closet, a tool for her desperate defense. She twists the top of the hanger, unwinding the wire, her fingers working frantically. The door breaks in with a final, deafening crash. The shape steps inside, pushing aside the clothes in his way. She unhooks the hanger and bends it out straight, her eyes fixed on the approaching threat. The shape leans in, peering down at Laurie in the corner, raising the knife for a final blow. Holding the hanger with both hands, she thrusts it forward with all her might, her survival instincts in overdrive. The wire hanger flashes into the shape's right eye, delivering a sudden, searing pain. He leaps back in pain, dropping the butcher knife, grabbing his eye with both hands, his invincibility shattered. She grasps the butcher knife with both hands and jabs it upward, fueled by adrenaline and resolve. The butcher knife plunges into the shape's mid-section, right down to the hilt, her aim unerring.

test_cases.name: Addition (~80%)
test_cases.description: The old woman stares at her suspiciously for a moment then turns from the door and walks away. Her hand reaches out and touches it. Tommy turns and runs upstairs crying. Laurie moves from the door to the telephone. She picks it up dials a number and waits. She puts down the phone and stands very still. Slowly Laurie moves around the couch. Slowly Laurie sinks down to her knees by the couch. Her hand brushes against the knitting needles protruding from her tote bag. She reacts to the feel of the knitting needles and pulls one out. She begins crying softly her eyes wide with fear. Suddenly the shape leaps up from behind the couch. He springs at her plunging the butcher knife. The blade of the butcher knife thumps into the couch. Laurie suddenly jumps backward raising her arm instinctively. Instinctively Laurie raises the knitting needle and drives it home right into the shape's neck. The shape springs backward clawing at the needle rolling his head back and forth. Then suddenly he freezes hands outstretched motionless and falls into a heap on the floor. Laurie sits there. The shape does not move. She stares at it. The camera moves with Loomis as he moves along the street. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. Suddenly two headlights hit him and a police car swerves to a stop next to him. Standing there is the shape the butcher knife raised. Both children scream. Laurie shoves them into the bathroom and pulls the door shut leaving herself outside in the bedroom. There is a click as the bathroom door is locked. Laurie leaps away from the door and circles around the bed. The shape keeps coming. The shape moves for her slowly now but relentless. the knife glistening. Laurie dashes to a clothes closet and ducks inside. Laurie pulls the sliding doors closed and crawls back into the small dark interior of the closet. Suddenly the doors begin to buckle as the shape pounds on them. The door buckles inward as the shape smashes against it. She reaches up and grabs a wire hanger from the top of the closet. She twists the top of the hanger unwinding the wire. The door breaks in. The shape steps inside pushing aside the clothes. She unhooks the hanger and bends it out straight. The shape leans in peering down at Laurie in the corner raising the knife. Holding the hanger with both hands she thrusts it forward with all her might The wire hanger flashes into the shape's right eye. He leaps back in pain dropping the butcher knife grabbing his eye with both hands. She grasps the butcher knife with both hands and jabs it upward. The butcher knife plunges into the shape's midsection right down to the hilt.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The young boy squints at him joyfully for an hour, then twirls from the window and skips closer. His foot stretches out and kicks it. Sarah twirls and dances downstairs laughing. Kevin leaps from the window to the megaphone. He snatches it up, punches a button, and listens. He drops the megaphone and lies very still. Quickly, Kevin leaps across the chair. Quickly, Kevin floats down to his toes by the chair. His foot taps against the paintbrushes poking from his backpack. He recoils at the touch of the paintbrushes and yanks one out. He starts laughing loudly, his mouth wide with surprise. Abruptly, the shadow spins out from under the chair! It lunges at him, thrusting the fishing rod. The tip of the fishing rod taps into the chair. Kevin quickly flips sideways, lifting his leg instinctively. Instinctively, Kevin lifts the paintbrush and plants it firmly, directly into the shadow's arm! The shadow flips sideways, scratching at the brush, shaking its arm up and down. Then abruptly it goes limp, arms raised, motionless, and sprawls into a jumble on the carpet. Kevin lies there. The shadow doesn't stir. He squints at it. The shot tracks with Parker as he glides along the sidewalk. Abruptly two flashlights spot him, and a firetruck careens to a halt beside him. Standing there is the shadow, the fishing rod thrust high. Both dogs bark. Kevin pushes them into the kitchen and swings the entry shut, leaving himself outside in the hallway. There is a clank as the kitchen entry is latched. Kevin skips away from the entry and spirals around the table. The shadow keeps advancing. The shadow strides towards him, quickly now, yet relentless, the rod gleaming. Kevin bolts to a pantry and squeezes inside. Kevin slides the folding panels shut and burrows back into the cramped, dim corner of the pantry. Abruptly the panels begin to bow as the shadow kicks against them. The panel bows outward as the shadow crashes into it. He stretches up and yanks a rope from the ceiling of the pantry. He wraps the top of the rope, unraveling the twine. The panel snaps in. The shadow marches inside, shoving past the coats. He unhooks the rope and bends it out straight. The shadow leans down, gazing at Kevin in the cubby, thrusting the rod. Grasping the rope with both feet, he jabs it outward with all his strength. The rope lashes into the shadow's left ear. It flips away in agony, dropping the fishing rod, clutching its ear with both feet. He clutches the fishing rod with both feet and stabs it downward. The fishing rod pierces into the shadow's chest, straight down to the base.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: The old woman briefly eyes Laurie suspiciously before leaving. Tommy runs upstairs crying. Laurie picks up the phone but then puts it down, feeling the knitting needles in her bag. Suddenly, the shape leaps from behind the couch with a butcher knife, but Laurie instinctively drives a knitting needle into its neck. The shape freezes and falls. Laurie, terrified, stares as the shape doesn't move. Loomis arrives on the street when a police car swerves to a stop. The shape, knife raised, causes Laurie to shove two kids into the bathroom, locking it behind them. She leaps away and hides in a closet. As the shape smashes the door, Laurie grabs a wire hanger, straightens it, and thrusts it into the shape's eye, causing it to recoil and drop the knife. Laurie then grasps the knife and plunges it into the shape's mid-section.
